results.title: Sergeant Swell of the Mounties
results.creator_credit: Chuck Menville, Len Janson and Pending Productions
results.brief_description: A spoof on the Royal Canadian Mounted Police in which our hero, Sergeant Swell, finds himself at odds with a local Indian tribe and a warrior who always seems to be just a few steps behind. Includes the ‘cliche’ lady in perpetual distress who requires continuous rescuing by the incompetent Swell.

results.title: The Juggler of Notre Dame
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of Anatole France’s story of a juggler named Barnaby who is given shelter in a monastery. To start with, the seemingly worthless Barnaby and his antics displease the monks, but one night his juggling causes a miracle, and the monks realise the worth of Barnaby and his talent. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Maths with everything
results.creator_credit: John Krish, John Arnold and A Graphic Film
results.brief_description: Demonstrates British child centred methods of teaching mathematics to children aged five to seven. The film’s point is that maths includes all activities if teachers know where to look for opportunities to teach it, using experiences that interest and totally involve the children. Explores thematic approach to mathematics. Begins with an in-service program for infant teachers. They construct a mural and then proceed to discover maths in it. A class teacher in a school situation then adopts the same approach using the theme ‘buses’.

results.title: Netsilik Eskimo: Fishing at the Stone Weir. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. In this film, it is full summer. The skin tents are up, and it is time to fish. The men go into the river to form enclosures to trap fish. Once trapped, they are speared with three-pronged leisters. A woman cleans the catch, which has been strung on a thong. Everyone enjoys bits of raw fish. Film without words.

results.title: At the winter sea ice camp. Pt. 3
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith, Education Development Center and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Center. In this part, work begins on a spacious community igloo. When the men return to their hunt, the women continue with their work and play games with the children. A seal is dragged into the igloo to be shared by everyone including the dogs, who are called in to clean up. (Award: Parno)

results.title: At the winter sea ice camp. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith, Education Development Center and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. This film show life at the campsite. Children amuse themselves with makeshift toys. Women tend their children, make clothes, and repair the igloos. When the men return with their catch, everyone goes inside where work, story-telling and games occupy each one’s time. Award: Parno. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Once upon a wilderness
results.brief_description: Passages from an early pioneer’s journal illustrate the contrast between the American wilderness then, and the environment today. Shows how the wilderness is being decimated by construction and “progress”, often without thought. Emphasises the importance of attitudes. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: L'Ile de la Cite
results.creator_credit: John Seabourne and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: An American girl visits the Ile de la Cite, the quais de la Seine and Ile Saint-Louis and has tea with a French friend. Conversation with a quayside bookseller, explanations of the island’s monuments and buildings and a humorous incident involving a phone call are also included. In French langauge.

results.title: Brand new key
results.brief_description: A lively animation based on Melanie’s popular song, finds the female lead skating into her boyfriends affections. A short, amusing film with uncluttered animation. Title song sung by Cher.

results.title: Take off
results.brief_description: A compilation of some of the best footage from the film “Ski the outer limits.” Skiers leap, twist, somersault, twirl and descend in successive multiple images. An innovative skier uses short skis to perform tricks that would not be possible on conventional skis.
